result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis K Mittelstadt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dennis K Mittelstadt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dennis K Mittelstadt was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Dennis K Mittelstadt was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certificate for treatment
from AP

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:43)
State - addresses stay being lifted of jail time
Kelm - argues - modify treatment court
Deft - has spoken with Ms. Goodell since she first got out of jail 3 months ago - was supposed to come to house Feb 4 but she didn't show - is doing very well in POP Group
State - POP group doesn't come close to inpatient treatment court - he's supposed to do a higher level of care and needs to be inpatient 
Kelm - deft will do inpatient - he's scheduled today

COURT:  not allowing POP group right now - report for residential care immediately

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Evan Thomas Bins Nordgren (by phone).  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:20)
State - probation was asking to life the stay - believes the stay should be lifted and get into treatment court or inpatient treatment
Nordgren - Kerry Kelm represents him

COURT:  set probation review
released on own recognizance
notify Kerry Kelm
Quash warrant
  Probation review hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared without the defendant.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Jacqueline Goodall in Court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:01) request to lift stay
Goodell - addresses Court - deft is at Soft Landings 
Kelm - addresses the court - given his treatment needs and mental health needs he needs something structured
State - notes indicate he would be better served through Treatment Court but he is low risk - if possible he should be ordered to do Treatment Court - Ms. Brantner indicated he was low risk
Goodell - did discuss treatment court with Mr. Mittelstadt
Kelm - deft didn't want to do treatment court because he didn't have a way to get there
Goodell - deft has served his first six months

COURT:  Orders Warrant for Mr. Mittelstadt
Goodell to contact Ms. Brantner to have him reassessed 
***double check address - deft at Soft Landings***
reserves judgment on treatment court
requests Ms. Kelm at subsequent hearings

due to past cases - matter transferred to Br 2

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:28)
Kelm - hearing on request made in August - Agent was confused  - if accepted into Arbor Place 6 months would be stayed - amended if accepted into in-patient treatment the last 6 months jail is stayed

COURT:  JOC amended to state "if defendant is accepted into in-patient treatment at Arbor Place the last six months of his conditional jail time is stayed pending compliance with both in patient and outpatient programming through Arbor"
Notice of Hearing
Notice of Hearing
Hearing at 10-23-2015 10:30 am
Letter from Defendant concerning treatment

Treatment Court Eligibility- Ineligible
Restitution Worksheet

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Brad Erickson in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:00)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentence - 3 yrs IC 3 yrs ES on Ct 1 & 3 concurrent, rest $220, $268 each count and $250 dna surchg each count; 13CM552 concurrent jail sent, cc $243, $200 dna surchg
Kelm - argues sentence - recommends w/held sent 2-3 yrs prob with no cond jail time his sole income is social security disability
Deft - argues sentence
Kelm - requests jail be in 20 days increments

COURT:
15CF103 Ct 1 - 3 yrs probation w/held sent - 1 yr jail with 6 months stayed if accepted into treatment court or DOC can set up treatment program - $268 cc $250 dna surchg
                Ct 3 - w/held sent 36 months - 1 yr jail concurrent to Ct 1 - with cond jail time and 6 months stayed upon treatment program - $268 cc $250 dna surch

13CM552 - 60 days jail concurrent to 15CF103 - $243 cc - no dna surchg - AODA assessment & comply, can be considered for treatment court - no alcohol or illegal drugs or misuse of prescription drugs

Denies jail time being 20 day increments - JAIL FORTHWITH

PAYMENT PLAN
Defense attorney called for PSI checked with PP. no answer two times, left message.
Bond Modification -Sent to Judge for Review/Signature
Hearing to ammend bond - Denied

4:20 cases called

Kelm:  Have agreement.  Defendant to plead Guilty to 15CF103 counts 1 & 3
and 13CM552,
Dismiss and Read In 15CF13 and any other counts in 15CF103

Defendant pleads Guilty of 13CM552
Defendant pleads Guilty to 15CF103 count 1 and count 3

Court : Dismiss 15CF103, counts 2, 4, & 5
and 15CF13
Finds waiver of rights voluntary
Finds factual basis in complaints
Finds defendant guilty to 13CM552
Finds defendant guilty to 15CF103 count 1 & 3

Orders PSI
Kelm argues for bond modification to sign bond
State argues against bond modification
Court: Denies bond modification  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:31)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Kelm - have matters resolved - has another case in Br 1 - requests matters heard in Br 1 status April 20

COURT:  bonds continue

15cf103 changed to hearing date in Br 2 from Br 1****  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Exhibit 1

Information filed

Def waives reading, pleads Not guilty

Kelm argues bond.  Defendant has medication issues that needs to be addressed.

COURT:  jail will handle medications.  Denies request to modify bond.

Defendant, Dennis K Mittelstadt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  2:45 pm

State calls Inv D. Westlund.  Sworn & testifies.  Ex. #1 - Certified copy of bond form, off'd & rec'd.  No cross.  Excused.

COURT:  finds probable cause, binds def over  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
